matched.match_rationale: Aarti Kava is a Senior Product Design Manager with experience in product design and business leadership, which overlaps with Mahima Singh Chauhan's role in product management and development.

detailed_profile.name: Aarti Kava
detailed_profile.position: Senior Product Design Manager | Fashion & Luxury e-commerce | Business Leadership
detailed_profile.about: As a Lead Product Designer at Tata CLiQ Luxury, I lead critical growth-driving projects that increase revenue streams, engagement, and brand collaborations. I set up future-ready processes using design best practices within my team, while creating design systems for seamless remote collaboration. I also mentor and groom designers across varying experience levels to take senior design roles. I have a Bachelor of Design degree in Industrial and Product Design from Symbiosis Institute Of Design, and have recently completed the BLUEMINT Leadership program for early career leaders across TATA group from London Business School. I have a passion for solving complex problems with engaging, emotional, and intuitive solutions. I have delivered unique shopping experiences on Tata CLiQ mall, Luxury and Beauty platforms, focusing on user satisfaction and bringing the app store rating to 4.8. I have also won the Best User Story Award for designing human interactions with an autonomous bus in a university campus environment.

experience.title: UI UX designer
experience.description: Independently working on creating and designing the user experience of a website for JM financial's new real-estate venture called DWELLO. Key responsibilities include UX wireframes, AB testing,UI design, userflows , empathy maps etc. I have also led the research and creation of a detailed customer engagement plan to effectively target DWELLO users to improve lead generation. The customer engagement program was designed by putting the users first and analysing the whole process of home buying through DWELLO from the customers point of view. The program ensures to minimise problems that the users would have otherwise experienced. This in turn benefits the company by gaining customer loyalty. Apart from this, I also work on designing marketing campaigns for real-estate developers which include the design of digital and print media advertisements keeping the focus on user experience throughout the process on engagment with the customer.

experience.title: Industrial Design Intern
experience.description: I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.It is a socially responsible design for rural india. I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who  work from their homes  in free time and the second product was  for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the  fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase
experience.description_html:
I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.
It is a socially responsible design for rural india.

I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who work from their homes in free time and the second product was for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.

This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: During my time at Godrej, I worked on a lot of small projects which include storyboarding, value-addition, form design for their new line of sofas. Additionally, I also conducted user research with a team by visiting around 35 homes in Mumbai to study how various potential customers are using their space at home. This was done to understand the target market and then design appropriate furniture sets solving the user problems and needs.

detailed_profile.name: Aarti Kava
detailed_profile.position: Senior Product Design Manager | Fashion & Luxury e-commerce | Business Leadership
detailed_profile.about: As a Lead Product Designer at Tata CLiQ Luxury, I lead critical growth-driving projects that increase revenue streams, engagement, and brand collaborations. I set up future-ready processes using design best practices within my team, while creating design systems for seamless remote collaboration. I also mentor and groom designers across varying experience levels to take senior design roles. I have a Bachelor of Design degree in Industrial and Product Design from Symbiosis Institute Of Design, and have recently completed the BLUEMINT Leadership program for early career leaders across TATA group from London Business School. I have a passion for solving complex problems with engaging, emotional, and intuitive solutions. I have delivered unique shopping experiences on Tata CLiQ mall, Luxury and Beauty platforms, focusing on user satisfaction and bringing the app store rating to 4.8. I have also won the Best User Story Award for designing human interactions with an autonomous bus in a university campus environment.

experience.title: UI UX designer
experience.description: Independently working on creating and designing the user experience of a website for JM financial's new real-estate venture called DWELLO. Key responsibilities include UX wireframes, AB testing,UI design, userflows , empathy maps etc. I have also led the research and creation of a detailed customer engagement plan to effectively target DWELLO users to improve lead generation. The customer engagement program was designed by putting the users first and analysing the whole process of home buying through DWELLO from the customers point of view. The program ensures to minimise problems that the users would have otherwise experienced. This in turn benefits the company by gaining customer loyalty. Apart from this, I also work on designing marketing campaigns for real-estate developers which include the design of digital and print media advertisements keeping the focus on user experience throughout the process on engagment with the customer.

experience.title: Industrial Design Intern
experience.description: I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.It is a socially responsible design for rural india. I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who  work from their homes  in free time and the second product was  for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the  fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase
experience.description_html:
I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.
It is a socially responsible design for rural india.

I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who work from their homes in free time and the second product was for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.

This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase

experience.title: UI UX designer
experience.description: Independently working on creating and designing the user experience of a website for JM financial's new real-estate venture called DWELLO. Key responsibilities include UX wireframes, AB testing,UI design, userflows , empathy maps etc. I have also led the research and creation of a detailed customer engagement plan to effectively target DWELLO users to improve lead generation. The customer engagement program was designed by putting the users first and analysing the whole process of home buying through DWELLO from the customers point of view. The program ensures to minimise problems that the users would have otherwise experienced. This in turn benefits the company by gaining customer loyalty. Apart from this, I also work on designing marketing campaigns for real-estate developers which include the design of digital and print media advertisements keeping the focus on user experience throughout the process on engagment with the customer.

experience.title: Industrial Design Intern
experience.description: I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.It is a socially responsible design for rural india. I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who  work from their homes  in free time and the second product was  for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the  fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase
experience.description_html:
I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.
It is a socially responsible design for rural india.

I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who work from their homes in free time and the second product was for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.

This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase

experience.description: During my time at Godrej, I worked on a lot of small projects which include storyboarding, value-addition, form design for their new line of sofas. This was done to understand the target market and then design appropriate furniture sets solving the user problems and needs.

projects.title: Effects of pipe bends, curvature ratios and flow regimes on the pressure loss coefficient of a pipe
projects.description: Project scope: Use of ANSYS Computational Fluid Dynamic Software to create pipes with different angles and bends. Project scope: Use of ANSYS Computational Fluid Dynamic Software to create pipes with different curvature ratios. Project scope: Use of ANSYS Computational Fluid Dynamic Software to monitor the mass flux, pressure drop and velocity contour on flows within pipe with varying flow regime of Laminar, Transition and Turbulent (varying Reynolds number) Project scope: To find the pressure loss coefficient in each pipe bend with varying curvature ratios and velocities. Manuscript submitted for publication of article on this project. Review in progress.

projects.title: Production of Formalin using a less energy intensive technology, Design Project
projects.description: Scope: Design a technology to produce Formalin in the most effective manner.Scope: Select a plant site whose location has proper weather and soil to construct plant as well as ample supply or raw materials, and good surrounding infrastructure and transportation systems. Construct Plant layout design using AutoCAD or Microsoft Visio. Scope: Design layout of plant in terms of BFD, PFD, P&ID, and Isometrics.Use of ASPEN PLUS and ASPEN HYSYS software to run project.Scope: Design and size equipment’s used in plant, by using Microsoft Excel for manual calculations and choosing of materials and line sizing. Scope: Safety and risk analysis as well as HAZOP and HAZID study of designed plant. Scope: Economic analysis of plant to calculate cumulative cash flow, production cost, labor cost, sensitivity studies, depreciation of plant and site and profit and loss.Manuscript submitted for publication of article on this project. Review in progress.

detailed_profile.name: Aarti Kava
detailed_profile.position: Senior Product Design Manager | Fashion & Luxury e-commerce | Business Leadership
detailed_profile.about: As a Lead Product Designer at Tata CLiQ Luxury, I lead critical growth-driving projects that increase revenue streams, engagement, and brand collaborations. I set up future-ready processes using design best practices within my team, while creating design systems for seamless remote collaboration. I also mentor and groom designers across varying experience levels to take senior design roles. I have a Bachelor of Design degree in Industrial and Product Design from Symbiosis Institute Of Design, and have recently completed the BLUEMINT Leadership program for early career leaders across TATA group from London Business School. I have a passion for solving complex problems with engaging, emotional, and intuitive solutions. I have delivered unique shopping experiences on Tata CLiQ mall, Luxury and Beauty platforms, focusing on user satisfaction and bringing the app store rating to 4.8. I have also won the Best User Story Award for designing human interactions with an autonomous bus in a university campus environment.

experience.title: UI UX designer
experience.description: Independently working on creating and designing the user experience of a website for JM financial's new real-estate venture called DWELLO. Key responsibilities include UX wireframes, AB testing,UI design, userflows , empathy maps etc. I have also led the research and creation of a detailed customer engagement plan to effectively target DWELLO users to improve lead generation. The customer engagement program was designed by putting the users first and analysing the whole process of home buying through DWELLO from the customers point of view. The program ensures to minimise problems that the users would have otherwise experienced. This in turn benefits the company by gaining customer loyalty. Apart from this, I also work on designing marketing campaigns for real-estate developers which include the design of digital and print media advertisements keeping the focus on user experience throughout the process on engagment with the customer.

experience.title: Industrial Design Intern
experience.description: I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.It is a socially responsible design for rural india. I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who  work from their homes  in free time and the second product was  for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the  fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase
experience.description_html:
I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.
It is a socially responsible design for rural india.

I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who work from their homes in free time and the second product was for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.

This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase

- Identified main issues in the SDK integration UX, designed and prioritised new “Integration Wizard” for the Ampiri product, which reduced 2x times users’ drop-off and became a new driver for the sales team.
- Managed a team of Product Managers to develop a new unified product from scratch with the focus on the synergy of the Ampiri ad mediation product and recently acquired real-time bidding startup. Worked across the organisation to define strategy and oversee processes of interviewing customers, analysing user flows and designing new UX for the unified product.

recommendations: Ayo Adeyefa “Dmitrii has an outstanding talent for leading product teams with both strategic vision and a hands-on approach. His ability to translate complex market demands into innovative product solutions is matched by his focus on customer experience and data-driven decision-making. I've witnessed his impact firsthand, from refining product roadmaps to inspiring cross-functional collaboration. Dmitrii is the type of CPO and entrepreneurial leader who not only drives results but also motivates those around, making him a valuable asset to any startup looking to scale.”

Raitis Dembovskis “Working with Dmitrii at Whitewall Media GmbH was a pleasure. Unlike many other product managers, Dmitrii focuses on high-level strategies and decisions and bases them on research and numbers. He lets the team decide the short term goals to accomplish the long term ones. Dmitrii also comes from a tech background, which allows him to participate in and contribute to technical discussions. I truly believe that Dmitrii would be a valuable asset to any company that wants to take its product to the next level.”

detailed_profile.about: As a seasoned Customer Success Manager with three years of experience, I have excelled in client-facing roles across diverse regions, including the Middle East, India, and the USA. My primary responsibilities have revolved around driving adoption, ensuring retention, and facilitating smooth onboarding processes for clients. Through proactive engagement and tailored solutions, I have effectively built and maintained strong relationships with clients, fostering trust and loyalty. By understanding the unique needs and challenges of each client, I have successfully implemented strategies to maximize their utilization of products or services, resulting in increased satisfaction and long-term value. My ability to navigate multicultural environments and adapt to various business landscapes has been instrumental in delivering exceptional customer experiences across international markets.

projects.title: Effects of pipe bends, curvature ratios and flow regimes on the pressure loss coefficient of a pipe
projects.description: Project scope: Use of ANSYS Computational Fluid Dynamic Software to create pipes with different angles and bends. Project scope: Use of ANSYS Computational Fluid Dynamic Software to create pipes with different curvature ratios. Project scope: Use of ANSYS Computational Fluid Dynamic Software to monitor the mass flux, pressure drop and velocity contour on flows within pipe with varying flow regime of Laminar, Transition and Turbulent (varying Reynolds number) Project scope: To find the pressure loss coefficient in each pipe bend with varying curvature ratios and velocities. Manuscript submitted for publication of article on this project. Review in progress.

projects.title: Production of Formalin using a less energy intensive technology, Design Project
projects.description: Scope: Design a technology to produce Formalin in the most effective manner.Scope: Select a plant site whose location has proper weather and soil to construct plant as well as ample supply or raw materials, and good surrounding infrastructure and transportation systems. Construct Plant layout design using AutoCAD or Microsoft Visio. Scope: Design layout of plant in terms of BFD, PFD, P&ID, and Isometrics.Use of ASPEN PLUS and ASPEN HYSYS software to run project.Scope: Design and size equipment’s used in plant, by using Microsoft Excel for manual calculations and choosing of materials and line sizing. Scope: Safety and risk analysis as well as HAZOP and HAZID study of designed plant. Scope: Economic analysis of plant to calculate cumulative cash flow, production cost, labor cost, sensitivity studies, depreciation of plant and site and profit and loss.Manuscript submitted for publication of article on this project. Review in progress.

detailed_profile.name: Aarti Kava
detailed_profile.position: Senior Product Design Manager | Fashion & Luxury e-commerce | Business Leadership
detailed_profile.about: As a Lead Product Designer at Tata CLiQ Luxury, I lead critical growth-driving projects that increase revenue streams, engagement, and brand collaborations. I set up future-ready processes using design best practices within my team, while creating design systems for seamless remote collaboration. I also mentor and groom designers across varying experience levels to take senior design roles. I have a Bachelor of Design degree in Industrial and Product Design from Symbiosis Institute Of Design, and have recently completed the BLUEMINT Leadership program for early career leaders across TATA group from London Business School. I have a passion for solving complex problems with engaging, emotional, and intuitive solutions. I have delivered unique shopping experiences on Tata CLiQ mall, Luxury and Beauty platforms, focusing on user satisfaction and bringing the app store rating to 4.8. I have also won the Best User Story Award for designing human interactions with an autonomous bus in a university campus environment.

experience.title: UI UX designer
experience.description: Independently working on creating and designing the user experience of a website for JM financial's new real-estate venture called DWELLO. Key responsibilities include UX wireframes, AB testing,UI design, userflows , empathy maps etc. I have also led the research and creation of a detailed customer engagement plan to effectively target DWELLO users to improve lead generation. The customer engagement program was designed by putting the users first and analysing the whole process of home buying through DWELLO from the customers point of view. The program ensures to minimise problems that the users would have otherwise experienced. This in turn benefits the company by gaining customer loyalty. Apart from this, I also work on designing marketing campaigns for real-estate developers which include the design of digital and print media advertisements keeping the focus on user experience throughout the process on engagment with the customer.

experience.title: Industrial Design Intern
experience.description: I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.It is a socially responsible design for rural india. I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who  work from their homes  in free time and the second product was  for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the  fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase
experience.description_html:
I researched, designed and developed a tool for reducing labour costs involved in processing of roselle fruit. This tool was created as a requirement for centre of science for villages, Wardha. The aim was to design a method/tool to increase the efficiency of Roselle Calyx separation thereby reducing the time and Labour costs involved. The initiative was carried out to increase entrepreneurship potential among farmers in India and elevate their earning capacity.
It is a socially responsible design for rural india.

I lead the project where I designed and developed the mechanism, product and process for calyx separation of the roselle fruit. Two products were designed- one for the household usgae or usage by female labourers who work from their homes in free time and the second product was for a largescale farmer who employs labourers to process the fruit. The final design was 5 times more efficient than the previous process used.

This project also won an award for social impact potential at the 2017 Symbiosis Design Showcase

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: During my time at Godrej, I worked on a lot of small projects which include storyboarding, value-addition, form design for their new line of sofas. Additionally, I also conducted user research with a team by visiting around 35 homes in Mumbai to study how various potential customers are using their space at home. This was done to understand the target market and then design appropriate furniture sets solving the user problems and needs.

recommendations: Ayo Adeyefa “Dmitrii has an outstanding talent for leading product teams with both strategic vision and a hands-on approach. His ability to translate complex market demands into innovative product solutions is matched by his focus on customer experience and data-driven decision-making. I've witnessed his impact firsthand, from refining product roadmaps to inspiring cross-functional collaboration. Dmitrii is the type of CPO and entrepreneurial leader who not only drives results but also motivates those around, making him a valuable asset to any startup looking to scale.”

Raitis Dembovskis “Working with Dmitrii at Whitewall Media GmbH was a pleasure. Unlike many other product managers, Dmitrii focuses on high-level strategies and decisions and bases them on research and numbers. He lets the team decide the short term goals to accomplish the long term ones. Dmitrii also comes from a tech background, which allows him to participate in and contribute to technical discussions. I truly believe that Dmitrii would be a valuable asset to any company that wants to take its product to the next level.”
